intro: Dryandra lindleyana subsp. pollosta, commonly known as the Geraldton Wax, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its unique, waxy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in winter. The plant has narrow, needle-like leaves and is adapted to grow in sandy, well-drained soils. It is part of the Proteaceae family, which includes many other woody plants with similar ecological adaptations. This subspecies is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
